description: The set of packages required by a given product version for a set of distros.

eol-date.description: End of life date of product version.

packages.description: Set of nominal packages used by product, with descriptions.

items.description: A nominal package is a distro-agnostic representation of a package, including the scenarios for which the package is required. A nominal package will be referenced a distribution package, with a distribution-specific package name.

required-scenarios.description: Required scenarios for which the package must be used.

items.description: Scenarios relating to package dependencies. 'All' includes both CoreCLR and NativeAOT while 'Runtime' is intended to cover CoreCLR, only.

distributions.description: Set of distributions where the product can be used.

items.description: An operating system distribution, with required package install commands and specific packages for distribution releases.

name.description: Name of the distribution, matching ID in /etc/os-release.

install-commands.description: Commands required to install packages within the distribution.

items.description: A command to be run to install packages

run-under-sudo.description: Whether the command needs to be run under sudo.

command-root.description: The command to be run, like apt.

command-parts.description: The command parts or arguments that need to be used.

items.description: A distribution release with a list of packages to install.

name.description: The name of the release, matching PRETTY_NAME in /etc/os-release.

release.description: The version number for the release, matching VERSION_ID in /etc/os-release.

items.description: A distro archive package to install, with a reference to a logical package with more information.

id.description: Reference to nominal package id, to providing access to required scenarios and other information.

name.description: Package name in the distro archive.
